description: Ultimately from Latin claustrālis (“of the cloister”), probably via Middle French cloistral. Doublet of claustral

adjectives.description: cloistral (comparative more cloistral, superlative most cloistral)

entries.meaning: Of, pertaining to, resembling or living in a cloister.

examples: [...] however cloistral our elementary schools may be, sheltering the eternal flame of the high ideal of human existence, Jimmy Shepherd, aged twelve, and Nancy Shepherd, aged thirteen, know very well that the eternal flame of the high ideal is all my-eye.
Where silence dwells if music be not there:
